Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia's Twenty20 World Cup hopes are hanging by a thread after falling victim to an all-out assault from Rohit Sharma and being beaten by 24 runs by India.
Rohit’s 19-ball 50 marked the fastest ever against Australia, with his dominance clear in the fact India’s team score was 1-52 when he passed the milestone.
Others: David Warner was dismissed in the first over of the chase for six, in what will be the veteran opener’s last international match if his team do not progress.
Mitch Marsh offered hope of a captain’s knock with 37 from 28 balls, but the match swung when he was superbly caught by a jumping Axar Patel on the boundary.
Glenn Maxwell also threatened to provide Travis Head the support he needed when he struck 15 off his first four balls, switch-hitting spinner Ravindra Jadeja.
The result means the undefeated India qualify for the semi-finals and will face England, while Australia’s hopes of being world champions in all formats are in grave danger.
